title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4207.25 - Undesirable persons to be ejected
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4207.25 - Undesirable persons to be ejected

State Regulations

No person who is known or reputed to be a bookmaker or a
vagrant within the meaning of the statutes of the State of New York, or a
fugitive from justice, or whose conduct at a race track in New York or
elsewhere, is or has been improper, obnoxious, unbecoming or detrimental to the
best interests of racing, shall enter or remain upon the premises of any
licensed association conducting a race meeting under the jurisdiction of the
commission; and all such persons shall upon discovery or recognition be
forthwith ejected. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

4207.25

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
